001package src.pkg_commands;
002
003import java.util.HashMap;
004/**
005 * The CommandWords class holds all the valid command words that the game recognizes.
006 * It is used to validate and recognize commands as they are typed by the player.
007 * 
008 * @author Pierre MATAR
009 */
010public class CommandWords
011{
012    // a constant array that will hold all valid command words
013    private final HashMap<String, CommandWord> aValidCommands;
014  
015    /**
016 * Constructor - initializes the list of valid command words thanks to an enumeration of commands.
017 */
018    public CommandWords()
019    {
020        this.aValidCommands = new HashMap<String, CommandWord>();
021       for (CommandWord command : CommandWord.values() ) {
022           this.aValidCommands.put(command.getDescription(), command);
023       }
024    } // CommandWords()
025
026    /**
027     * Returns the CommandWord enum corresponding to the given command string.
028     * If the string is not a valid command, it returns the "?" command word.
029     * 
030     * @param pCommandString The command string entered by the player.
031     * @return The corresponding CommandWord, or the "?" command if the string is not valid.
032     */
033    public CommandWord getCommandWord(final String pCommandString) {
034    
035        return this.aValidCommands.get(pCommandString) != null ? this.aValidCommands.get(pCommandString) : this.aValidCommands.get("?");
036        
037    }
038
039 /**
040 * @return A string containing all valid commands separated by a space.
041 */
042
043    public String getCommandList() {
044        StringBuilder vCommandList = new StringBuilder("");
045        for (String command : this.aValidCommands.keySet())
046            vCommandList.append(command).append(" ");
047        return vCommandList.toString();
048    } //getCommandList
049} // CommandWords$
